summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, dated April 9, 2021. It transmits a batch of discovery materials, including American Express records, T-Mobile records, Customs and Border Patrol records, FBI Florida materials related to the Alfredo Rodriguez investigation, and Palm Beach Police Department records and video surveillance footage. The letter notes the materials are governed by a protective order and that the production of the Rodriguez investigation files is made as a courtesy, not a legal obligation.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a large batch of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, including financial, telecom, law enforcement, and surveillance records.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On April 9, 2021, the U.S. Attorney's Office produced extensive discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including American Express records, T-Mobile records, Customs and Border Patrol records, FBI Florida files on Alfredo Rodriguez, and Palm Beach Police records and video.

The production includes materials from the FBI investigation into Alfredo Rodriguez, who was prosecuted in a separate case (10 Cr. 80015). The government explicitly states this production is a courtesy, not an admission of a legal obligation under Rule 16.
All produced materials are governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and the transmittal letter itself is designated as 'confidential.'

The document reveals an investigative link between the Maxwell case and the prior investigation/prosecution of Alfredo Rodriguez, suggesting Rodriguez may have been an associate or held information relevant to the Maxwell prosecution.
